creditline: Gift of the Robert B. Mayer Memorial Loan Collection
text: This graceful jar portrays elegantly dressed ladies strolling and playing musical instruments in a tranquil garden setting. The scene, painted in rich cobalt blue, reflects the refined lifestyle and aesthetic ideals of the Qing court, where beauty, harmony, and cultured leisure were celebrated. The rhythmic composition of figures amid trees, rocks, and fences conveys a poetic sense of balance and serenity. Such jars were often displayed in scholar’s studios or elite households, symbolizing refinement, prosperity, and appreciation for the arts within the broader context of Chinese porcelain craftsmanship.
title: Baluster jar
